alert.note: Alert for Cheyenne County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 28 at 8:19PM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...Outflow from Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Cheyenne County in east central Colorado, northwestern Wichita, Wallace, western Logan, Greeley Counties in west central Kansas and southern Sherman Counties in northwestern Kansas through 900 PM MDT/1000 PM CDT/... At 818 PM MDT/918 PM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking outflow from strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 12 miles south of Ruleton to 4 miles north of Sharon Springs to 9 miles northwest of Towner. Movement was southeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Sharon Springs around 825 PM MDT. Wallace around 830 PM MDT. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. This thunderstorm will produce strong winds resulting in areas of near zero visibility in blowing dirt. Use extreme caution if you must travel and be alert for rapidly changing visibility. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Goodland.
